name: Bball Republic Day Tournament - Individual Booking
description:
Republic Day Basketball Tournament - Individual Registration  
REPORTING TIME: 8:15 AM 
Sign up as an individual and if you don't have a team, we will assing you to a team. 
Game Details: 
 
 Format: 5s games with teams of 8 (5 players, 3 subs). 
 Level: Open to all levels 
 At any given time, there must be 3 active Sisters and 2 active Misters on the court. 
 Substitutions: 
  
 Sisters can replace only Sisters. 
 Misters can replace only Misters. 
 Additional subs can register as individuals. 
  
  
 
Tournament Structure: 
 
 Round Robin: Every team plays against every other team. 
 Matches: Each team plays 4 matches, including a 3rd place match/finals 
 Game Duration: 
  
 8-2-8 (Two halves of 8 minutes each with a 2-minute halftime) 
  
  
 
Theme: 
 
 Teams will represent one color of the Indian flag (4 teams total). 
 
Facilities: 
 
 Changing rooms, washrooms, parking, and water will be available at the venue. 
 Please carry your own water bottles. 
 
A detailed document with tournament rules will be shared closer to the event. 
For any further queries contact - Vaibhavi: 9886520914

location.name: St. Joseph's Arts And Science College

name: Pole Workshop with Azdah
description:
Looking for a fun way to boost your fitness and confidence? Join us for a 90-minute pole workshop! This class is perfect for everyone, whether you're a complete beginner or looking to build on your skills. Azdah, our incredible instructor will be there to support you every step of the way, helping you learn new moves and have a great time. It’s all about discovering your strength, feminity and expressing yourself in a welcoming environment.  
Date: 2nd February  2025, Sunday 
Time: 3 - 4.30 pm (Please arrive at the studio by 2.45 pm) 
Venue: Azdah, Indiranagar 
Attire: We’d recommend tight clothing that exposes as much skin as possible, because the skin to bar contact is very important. So you can carry a sports bra and cycling shorts or something of the sort! 
*Be sure to bring a water bottle to stay hydrated! 
Contact Saachi (9513334690) for more info

location.name: Azdah
location.address: Third Floor,  North Portion,  549/3,  9th A Main Rd,  Stage 1,  Indiranagar,  Bengaluru,  Karnataka 560038

name: Hike with the Sisters, Misters and Monks on Wheels
description:
Ladies! You asked and we've made it happen! Introducing this beginner-friendly trek to one of the most beautiful locations, just a 1 hour drive away from the city. Join us for a surreal hike experience! 
This hike will be led by certified mountaineers from the Monks on Wheels community - thus ensuring safety and security throughout the experience. 
Location: Near Chikkaballapur, Karnataka. 
Altitude: Approximately 2710 feet (826 meters) above sea level. 
Difficulty Level: Easy, suitable for first time trekkers. 
Trek Duration: Usually takes about 2 hours to complete the round trip. 
--- 
Trek Route 
Route: The trek begins from the base of Gudibande village and ascends through rocky paths and small hills. The trail is not very well-marked, so some route finding is required. The climb is gradual with a few steep sections as you approach the fort. 
Gudibande Fort: The trek culminates at the Gudibande Fort, which is perched atop a hill and offers panoramic views of the surrounding plains, hills, and the nearby Nandi Hills range. 
--- 
Key Highlights 
•⁠  ⁠Historical Significance: The fort, built by Byre Gowda of the Tuluva Dynasty in the 17th century, has a rich history and was used by local rulers for defense. The fort has seven levels with interconnecting escape routes which would help soldiers to flee in case of emergency. On the top of the fort is a Shiva temple known as "Sir Rameshwara Temple", established by Sage Vishwamitra and Lord Rama which is believed to be one of the 108 Jyotirlingas. 
•⁠  ⁠Scenic Views: From the top, you get an excellent view of the surrounding landscape, including the rocky hills and vast plains. The fort’s architecture and the remains of watchtowers are also a significant highlight. 
--- 
Things to carry: 
 
 Umbrellas or caps (optional) 
 Carry bags 
 Water bottle 
 Odomos 
 Medicines (if any) 
 Mobile Charger 
 First Aid Kit 
 Extra pair of clothing 
 Sufficient amount of cash 
 Portable chargers 
 Tissues 
 Masks 
 Sanitizers 
 Sunscreen 
 
Attire: 
 
 Trek shoes (any footwear with good grip will do) 
 Full pants (track pants or leggings) 
 A dri-fit tshirt  
 
Inclusions: 
 
 Breakfast (Veg) 
 Snacks  
 Trek to Gudibande Fort 
 Transport to and from Bangalore Club 
 First Aid kit in case of emergencies 
 2 or more certified guides from Monks on Wheels to manage and keep you entertained throughout the event 
 
--- 
This hike is for community members and their friends, so feel free to book spots for some Misters you know too! 
Reach out to Saachi (9513334690) for more details.

name: Baddy With Sisters, Beginner + Intermediate - Play Zone
url: https://sistersinsweat.in/session_details/badminton/Baddy With Sisters, Beginner + Intermediate - Play Zone
description:
Badminton for Beginners & Intermediates! 
Whether you’re picking up a racket for the first time or looking to improve your game, our Beginner & Intermediate Badminton sessions are designed to help you build confidence, refine your technique, and have a great time on the court. You’ll get the chance to learn through drills, practice sessions, and friendly matches, making every game both a learning experience and a whole lot of fun. sessions are 120mins long. 
What to wear? comfortable workout clothes and non-marking shoes 
What to bring? A bottle of water, a towel to wipe off sweat (if required) and loads of entusiasm to play :) See you on the court sisters! 
For any further queries contact 
Vaibhavi - 9886520914

name: Run With The Sisters
description:
Bangalore Sisters! 
 
There's nothing quite like starting your Sunday by running in Cubbon Park - the lungs of the city - with a group of amazing women! 
 
The Run session is led by an instructor and includes warm up, a 3K/5K run in the park (based on your comfort) and cool down.  
 
Meeting Time: 6:50am 
Meeting Point: In front of Coffee Day Square, across Cubbon Park 
 
After everyone has collected at the meeting point, we walk across to Cubbon Park by around 7am, where the instructor will begin the Warm Up. 
 
Level: This session is open to runners of all Levels, from absolute beginners to regular runners. 
 
What you should carry: 
• Bottle of water 
• Running shoes preferable 
 
In case of any queries, feel free to contact: 
Adit: +91 89514 18918 
Tanvie: +91 8800199418
